item.title: 洛杉矶发起一场新的城市灭火战争
item.description: 南加州居民在经历了一周的野火肆虐之后，又迎来了新的一天。请关注最新消息。此外，彭博社记者将在美国东部时间周三上午 10:45 的现场直播问答中回答有关气候灾害如何影响美国房屋保险市场的问题。在此加入。【原文：Southern California residents are facing another day of tinderbox conditions after an exhausting week of wildfires. Follow the latest updates. Plus, Bloomberg reporters will answer questions about how climate disasters are impacting the US home insurance market during a live Live Q&A Wednesday at 10:45am EST. Join here.】

item.title: 如何度过下一场城市火灾风暴
item.description:
消防专家建议，在未来的城市野火 灾害发生之前，应加强培训、加固房屋和提前疏散。【原文：

Fire experts suggest more training, home hardening and early evacuations in advance of future urban wildfire disasters.

】

item.title: 强风导致火险升级，洛杉矶岌岌可危
item.description: 在这场已造成至少 24 人丧生、数千人背井离乡并引发政治内讧的灾难之后，南加州干风肆虐，洛杉矶再次面临野火肆虐的危险。【原文：Los Angeles is bracing for critical wildfire conditions again as dry winds scour Southern California, creating the risk of more blazes in the wake of a disaster that has killed at least 24 people, driven thousands from their homes and touched off political infighting.】

item.title: 贸易战将减缓电池价格在 2025 年的暴跌
item.description: 据 BloombergNEF 分析师称，由于贸易紧张局势和金属价格的不断上升，电池价格将连续第三年下跌，但跌幅不会像过去那么大。【原文：Battery prices are set to fall for a third straight year — though not nearly as much as in the past, due to rising trade tensions and metals prices, according to analysts at BloombergNEF.】

item.title: 零售商助力电动汽车充电站突击行动
item.description:
上一季度上线的加油站数量创下历史新高，旨在为无法在家充电的驾驶员提供服务。【原文：

A record number of stations came online last quarter in a bid to serve drivers who can’t charge at home.

】

item.title: 特朗普能源部长人选誓言 "释放 "美国的扩张活力
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的能源部长人选在周三参议院确认听证会上的书面证词称，美国必须消除官僚障碍，"释放 "核能和液化天然气的生产。【原文：Donald Trump’s choice for Energy secretary said the US must remove bureaucratic barriers and “unleash” production of nuclear power as well as liquified natural gas, according to written testimony before his Senate confirmation hearing on Wednesday.】

item.title: 德国风力发电量下降，法国核电产量跃升至 2019 年新高
item.description: 法国核能发电量攀升至近六年来的最高水平，弥补了西欧风力发电量的下降。【原文：French nuclear generation climbed to the highest level in almost six years, compensating for lower wind-power output in western Europe.】

item.title: 英国电网暂停新申请以改革连接流程
item.description: 随着运营商努力实施更高效的系统来增加发电量，希望加入英国电网并网队列的新项目将面临暂停。【原文：New projects looking to join the queue to connect to the UK’s power grid will face a pause as the operator works to implement a more efficient system to add capacity.】

item.title: 战争焦虑笼罩达沃斯专家，乌克兰和平仍遥遥无期
item.description: 尽管即将上任的美国总统唐纳德-特朗普誓言结束乌克兰的敌对状态，但战争仍是世界经济论坛调查的风险专家最担心的问题。【原文：War is the top worry wracking the nerves of risk experts surveyed by the World Economic Forum, despite incoming US President Donald Trump’s vow to end hostilities in Ukraine.】

item.title: 120 亿美元气候基金刚刚完成首次债券销售
item.description: 气候投资基金资本市场机制刚刚首次进入资本市场，在收到六倍于该数额的投标后，出售了 5 亿美元的债券。【原文：The Climate Investment Funds Capital Markets Mechanism just tapped the capital markets for the first time, selling $500 million of bonds after receiving bids for more than six times that amount.】

item.title: 中国国家电网计划在绿色浪潮中投入创纪录的 890 亿美元
item.description: 中国最大的电网运营商国家电网公司计划将投资额提高到创纪录的水平，以跟上可再生能源发电量激增的步伐。【原文：State Grid Corp. of China, the nation’s largest power network operator, plans to raise investments to a record as it seeks to keep pace with surging renewable generation.】

item.title: 洛杉矶在一周的火焰之后面临大风和无降雨迹象
item.description: 南加州居民在一周的野火、疏散、停电和学校关闭中疲惫不堪，今晚又将面临严重的火灾危险，因为圣安娜风卷土重来，有可能在整个地区燃起熊熊大火。【原文：Southern California residents exhausted by a week of wildfires, evacuations, blackouts and school closures face another night of critical fire danger, as returning Santa Ana winds threaten to fan flames across the region.】

item.title: 丰田对电动汽车的研究还能拖多久？
item.description:
全球第一大汽车制造商一直专注于混合动力车和油耗车，无论好坏。【原文：

The world’s No. 1 automaker has kept its focus on hybrids and gas-guzzlers, for better and worse.

】

item.title: 爱迪生公司决定维持洛杉矶输电线运营的决定引起关注
item.description: 爱迪生国际公司（Edison International）决定在上周历史性的暴风雪期间让洛杉矶的一些供电线路继续运行，这一决定正受到审查，因为对该市毁灭性野火的调查正在加速进行。【原文：Edison International’s decision to leave some Los Angeles power lines operating during a historic windstorm last week is under scrutiny as an investigation into the city’s devastating wildfires gathers pace.】

item.title: 巴克莱备忘录揭示美国银行退出气候联盟的 "谈话要点
item.description: 巴克莱银行（Barclays Plc）向员工发送了一份备忘录，以应对有关其在气候联盟中地位的问题，该联盟已被华尔街最大的银行抛弃。【原文：Barclays Plc has sent a memo to staff in anticipation of questions regarding its status inside a climate alliance that’s been abandoned by Wall Street’s biggest banks.】

item.title: 火灾加剧住房紧张，洛杉矶月租金达 4 万美元
item.description: 在毁灭性的野火将整个社区烧为平地之前，洛杉矶就已经存在住房可负担性危机。这场灾难让情况变得更糟。【原文：Los Angeles already had a housing affordability crisis before devastating wildfires burned entire neighborhoods to the ground. The disaster is making it worse.】

item.title: 图恩计划利用快速法案实现能源 "主导权
item.description: 参议院多数党领袖约翰-图恩（John Thune）表示，他计划利用共和党新任多数党正在制定的快速预算法案来扩大石油和天然气生产，实现美国的 "能源主导地位"。【原文：Senate Majority Leader John Thune said he plans to use a fast-track budget bill being crafted by the new Republican majority to expand oil and gas production and achieve US “energy dominance.”】

item.title: 随着风力增大，洛杉矶又将面临一天的极端火灾风险
item.description: 南加州洛杉矶及周边地区正在遭受干热风的袭击，野火风险至少会持续到本周三，因为大火已造成至少 24 人死亡，附近居民区被烧成废墟。【原文：Hot, dry winds are pummeling Los Angeles and surrounding areas of Southern California, raising wildfire risks through at least Wednesday as the region reels from blazes that have killed at least 24 people and burned neighborhoods to the ground.】

item.title: 德国大选热门人选因绿色钢铁疑虑引发反弹
item.description: 德国保守派领跑者弗里德里希-梅尔茨（Friedrich Merz）对钢铁行业的绿色转型表示怀疑，引发了下月大选前的激烈辩论。【原文：Germany’s conservative front-runner Friedrich Merz cast doubt on the steel industry’s green transition, sparking a fierce debate before snap elections next month.】

item.title: 银行声称他们仍在与气候作斗争。真的吗？
item.description:
华尔街巨头逃离了一个重要的气候联盟，一些人担心他们可能会失去为低碳转型提供资金的胃口。【原文：

Having fled a major climate alliance, some worry Wall Street giants may lose their stomach for financing a low-carbon transition.

】

item.title: 德国燃油发电量激增，风能发电量将大幅下降
item.description: 德国的石油发电量飙升至至少 2017 年以来的最高水平，因为欧洲电力供应商正准备应对风能的下滑。【原文：Germany’s electricity generation from oil surged to the highest since at least 2017, as European power providers prepare for a slump in wind energy.】

item.title: 利用 DNA 测定生物多样性的英国初创公司融资 2500 万美元
item.description:
随着监管机构越来越重视公司对生物圈的影响，NatureMetrics为他们提供了了解公司运营地的土地和水域的工具。【原文：

As regulators take a harder look at companies’ impact on the biosphere, NatureMetrics offers them tools to understand the land and waters where they operate.

】

item.title: 阿联酋绿色能源公司计划建造首座与电池相连的太阳能发电厂
item.description: 阿拉伯联合酋长国的主要绿色能源生产商正在规划一个项目，将太阳能发电与电池储能连接起来，以提供不间断的电力。【原文：The United Arab Emirates’ main green energy producer is planning a project to link solar power with battery storage to provide uninterrupted power.】

item.title: 高盛认为加州野火对美国就业的拖累 "不大
item.description: 据高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Deadly wildfires in Los Angeles County will likely result in only a “modest drag” on US jobs growth, even as the blazes shape as one of the costliest natural disasters in US history, according to Goldman Sachs Group Inc.】

item.title: 大火肆虐的洛杉矶准备应对更强的狂风
item.description: 南加州面临着将于周一晚间开始的新一轮危险的火灾天气，即使工作人员正在努力控制风力造成的大火，大火已造成洛杉矶瘫痪近一周，并导致至少 24 人死亡。【原文：Southern California faces another round of dangerous fire weather set to begin Monday night, even as crews struggle to contain wind-driven blazes that have paralyzed Los Angeles for nearly a week and killed at least 24 people.】

item.title: 智利在推进补贴法案时回避可再生能源利润掠夺问题
item.description: 智利下议院批准了一项扩大对低收入家庭电力补贴的法案，但取消了一项通过限制可再生能源行业利润来筹集部分所需资金的措施。【原文：Chile’s lower house approved a bill to expand electricity subsidies for lower-income families after stripping out a measure that would have raised part of the funds required by curbing profits in a segment of the renewable energy industry.】

item.title: 俄罗斯扩大对几十年来最大黑海灾难的应对范围
item.description: 在克里姆林宫继续评估这场灾难的全面规模之际，俄罗斯成立了一个新的政府委员会，负责协调清理黑海近代史上最大的石油产品泄漏事件。【原文：Russia has formed a new government commission to coordinate clean up of the biggest spill of oil products in the Black Sea in recent history as the Kremlin continues to assess the full scale of the catastrophe.】

item.title: 冰岛报告最大冰川爆发洪水
item.description: 据冰岛气象局称，冰岛最活跃的火山之一瓦特纳若库尔（Vatnajokull）冰川下已经开始爆发冰川洪水。【原文：A glacial outburst flood has started from underneath Iceland’s Vatnajokull glacier, the site of one of the country’s most active volcanoes, according to its Met Office.】

item.title: 这些房屋经受住了洛杉矶大火的考验。建筑师解释原因
item.description:
在太平洋帕利塞兹和马里布，一些采用防火设计的房屋在一片废墟中依然屹立不倒。【原文：

In Pacific Palisades and Malibu, some houses with fire-resistant designs remained standing amid neighborhoods of destruction. 

】

item.title: 石油行业在夏威夷气候诉讼案上遭最高法院唾弃
item.description: 美国最高法院支持环保倡导者要求石油公司对气候变化负责的努力，允许火奴鲁鲁提起诉讼，指控石油公司在化石燃料带来的风险方面欺骗客户。【原文：The US Supreme Court buttressed efforts by environmental advocates to hold oil companies accountable for climate change, letting Honolulu press a lawsuit that accuses the industry of deceiving customers about the risks posed by fossil fuels.】
